intro: Scilla zangezura, commonly known as Persian scilla, is a flowering plant native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers well-drained conditions. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Scilla zangezura is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
